subject: Fashion
title: The Organic Cotton Truth
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Organic Cotton Truth.

hook.text: Organic cotton sounds perfect. No pesticides, less water, better for farmers. But it's complicated.

buildup.text: Organic cotton uses 91% less irrigation water. But it yields 20-30% less per acre than conventional.

discovery.text: Lower yields mean farmers need more land for the same output, potentially driving deforestation.

twist.text: Organic certification is expensive. Small farmers who already farm sustainably often can't afford the label.

climax.text: Organic cotton is genuinely better in many waysâ€”but it's not the silver bullet its marketing suggests.

punchline.text: Better than conventional? Yes. Perfect? Not even close.

quiz.question: What is a key limitation of organic cotton compared to conventional cotton?
options: It yields 20-30% less per acre, requiring more land to produce the same amount
It uses significantly more water during the growing process
It requires more synthetic pesticides to protect against pests
